block.p: Melissa Berry McCaffery, the daughter of Mary Lynn Putney of Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y., and Paul McCaffery of Edison, N.J., was married yesterday to Jonathan David Abraham, a son of Judith and Richard Abraham of Canton, Conn. Joaquin F. Alemany, a village justice of Sleepy Hollow, N.Y., performed the ceremony at the Sleepy Hollow Country Club in Scarborough, N.Y.
Mrs. Abraham, 28, teaches world history at the Pingry School in Martinsville, N.J. She graduated from Princeton University and received a master's degree in education from Columbia.

Melissa Berry McCaffery, the daughter of Mary Lynn Putney of Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y., and Paul McCaffery of Edison, N.J., was married yesterday to Jonathan David Abraham, a son of Judith and Richard Abraham of Canton, Conn. Joaquin F. Alemany, a village justice of Sleepy Hollow, N.Y., performed the ceremony at the Sleepy Hollow Country Club in Scarborough, N.Y.
Mrs. Abraham, 28, teaches world history at the Pingry School in Martinsville, N.J. She graduated from Princeton University and received a master's degree in education from Columbia.

The bride's father works in Edison for Wells Fargo Home Mortgage, where he is its vice president overseeing the New York metropolitan region. Her mother is a managing director for global investments at Citigroup and an adjunct professor at the Columbia University School of Business, both in New York. The bride is the stepdaughter of Judith McCaffery and of Frederick Putney.

Mr. Abraham, 29, is a partner in Abraham & Lerner, a law firm in New York. He graduated from Bucknell University and received a law degree from Fordham. His mother is a physical therapist and his father an internist, both in private practice in Canton, Conn.
